cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 480 miles ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving quickly west toward the south-Texas coast with landfall expected early Tuesday, then continuing west-northwest inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-Texas coast near Port Mansfield/Baffin Bay

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Texas coast from the Rio Grande northward to Matagorda Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (peak probability 3%) possible Tuesday morning through afternoon; gusts could reach 35–45 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of inundation possible along the lower Texas coast, including the Brownsville area, if peak surge aligns with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated amounts up to 7 inches Tuesday–Wednesday, producing a risk of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning Monday night.
